review_title: Small but growing social justice oriented university community
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Small, but growing, social justice oriented community focused on psychology and counseling, with great staff, faculty, and students. Administration who cares about staff and students and faculty and emphasizes focus on students and inclusion.
cons: Staff stretched thin as organization grows. Weak benefits packages due to small size of organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Students are nice, most faculty care, some staff still care about students.
cons:
Racism is rampant
Nepotism is rampant
Ageism is highly apparent
Incredible lack of staff/faculty diversity 
Performance reviews are non-existent as well as raises

HR is terrible about confidentiality, if you report someone they tell the person to go talk with you to squash it. No mediation no questions.

The CIO doesn't understand basic software differences or data security and openly admits he his lazy and doesn't want to do anything.

Marketing took 2 years to change a logo, and all they did was remove the background, change fonts, and remove the old tag line. Honestly.

There is NO leadership at this place and not enough staff to realize the ideas fully, in my 45 years of work I've NEVER worked at a more dysfunctional and racist environment. Leadership has no idea what people working under them are doing or what their responsibilities are until something breaks.

They expect you to be on call 24/7 if you are salaried, stick to hourly pay if you can or kiss your weekends goodbye.

At the moment entire departments are quitting, place is SO toxic. STAY AWAY!

pros: I think there are some great things about PAU, but there are a lot of challenges that would take a LOT of work to address. I think it could be a great place in 5-10 years.
cons: Extremely political environment, and lots of turnover.

review_title: An experience one may never have again
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Some really great staff and faculty members who have managed to stick around despite the touchy politics of the institution. Compelling institutional philosophy aligned with far-left political leanings and helping those in need.  Beautiful main campus set in the middle of a nature preserve. Youthful, college campus environment with students who are mostly kind and pleasant. Tuition waived if you have the right connections to upper management.
cons: Major issues with space due to the increasing cost of leasing property in the Palo Alto/Los Altos area which creates tension among staff and faculty. Upper management resistance to hiring sufficient human resources management to serve staff needs. No food service on the main campus for. More emphasis on public relations and growth than on supporting the main student body (doctoral students) who need more resources in order to be well-trained, successful psychologists.

job_title: Senior Teaching Assistant in New York, NY
pros: The salary is very good and you will gain a lot of diver experience in the field which will help build your resume and is unlike anything you will find at another company
cons: The clients are very intense and demeaning and the hours can be quite long with some travel as well

doesn't really matter how much efforts you put in. The upper management will promote and reward the wrong people.
